abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says that a 60 percent increase in emergency room visits from children and adolescents suffering from brain injuries indicates increased awareness of the dangers of concussions.
snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said the 60 percent increase in visits from 2001 to 2009 may be a result of increased awareness of the dangers of head injuries.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

lead_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said the 60 percent increase in visits from 2001 to 2009 may be a result of increased awareness of the dangers of head injuries.

headline.main: Report Indicates an Increase in Concussion Awareness
headline.print_headline: Report Indicates an Increase in Concussion Awareness
headline.seo: Report Shows Rise in E.R. Visits for Concussions Among Young
